page.syntax: C STRWORDTRAN(C character,C substring,[C replacement,[N start_pos,[N occurrences[,N every]]]])
page.description: Replaces each occurrence of a word with another.
page.original:
STRWORDTRAN() Syntax Output_String as C = STRWORDTRAN( Input_String as C, Find_Word as C [, Replacement_Word as C [, Start_Word as C [, Occurrences as N ]]] ) Argument Description Input_String A character string. Find_Word The word to find in the Input_String. Replacement_Word Optional. Default = "" (NULL). The word that replaces the Find_Word. Start_Word Optional. Default = 1. Specifies which (and subsequent) occurrences will be replaced. A value N for the optional Start_Word begins the replacement at the N th occurrence of Find_Word. Occurrences Optional. Default = All. Specifies the maximum number of occurrences of Find_String to replace with Replace_String.
Description Replaces every occurrence of Find_Word in Input_String with a Replacement_Word. If Replacement_Word is omitted, Find_Word is replaced with NULL characters. A value N for the optional Start_Word begins the replacement at the N th occurrence of Word. A value for the optional Occurrences specifies the maximum number of occurrences of Word to be replaced. Note : You can use STRWORDTRAN() with memo fields. Limitations The Find_String argument is case sensitive. Examples strwordtran("partnership is the most important part of part of a successful relationship", "part", "element") -> "partnership is the most important element of element of a successful relationship" STRTRAN("partnership is the most important part of part of a successful relationship", "part", "element") -> "elementnership is the most important element of element of a successful relationship" strwordtran("She sells sea shell on the sea shore","sea","ocean", 2, 1) -> "She sells sea shell on the ocean shore"
See Also Character Replacement Functions
